snippet: The Affordable Care Act has many doctors in private practice anxious about the future as those employed by hospital systems are enjoying security in a changing landscape.
abstract: Implementation of Affordable Care Act is accelerating the economic and logistical pressures that had already been pushing many private doctors toward the security of hospital networks; groups offer significant bargaining power, negotiating with insurers on doctors' behalf and providing equipment and database support; some physicians worry that loss of autonomy may result in worsened care for patients (Series: Remaking Medicine).
lead_paragraph: The Affordable Care Act has many doctors in private practice anxious about the future as those employed by hospital systems are enjoying security in a changing landscape.

headline.print_headline: New Law’s Demands on Doctors Have Many Seeking a Network
headline.main: New Law’s Demands on Doctors Have Many Seeking a Network

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
